core

Interface LooseSolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GreedyLoose

    public interface LooseSolver
    Interface that components which want to be a Loose associator need to implement. This is the minimal API offered to the component client. The component needs to take a table, a list of constraints and a list of fragments and create a loose association when associate is called.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Triplet<BaseAssociations,BaseFragments,java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> associate(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> kList)
      Create the loose association using the group sizes k described in the kList for each fragment.
      <C,F> void initializeProblem(BaseTable table, java.util.List<java.util.List<C>> constraints, java.util.List<java.util.List<F>> fragments)
      Initialize the problem from table, constraints and fragments.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeProblem

        <C,F> void initializeProblem(BaseTable table,
                           java.util.List<java.util.List<C>> constraints,
                           java.util.List<java.util.List<F>> fragments)
        Initialize the problem from table, constraints and fragments. The list of constraints and fragments are generic because we can mix attribute names and indices, for example if the attributes in a table are ["a", "b", "c"], the constraint (or fragment) ["a", "b"] can be expressed as ["a", "b"] or [0, 1] or even [0, "b"] and ["a", 1] Fragments and constraints are list of lists so for example [[0, 1], [1, 2], ...]
        Type Parameters:
        C - the generic type of constraints
        F - the generic type of fragments
        Parameters:
        table - the table (source of data)
        constraints - the list of constraints
        fragments - the list of fragments

      • associate

        Triplet<BaseAssociations,BaseFragments,java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> associate(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> kList)
                                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Create the loose association using the group sizes k described in the kList for each fragment. a kList of [2, 3] imposes k=2 in the first fragment and k= 3 in the second fragment.
        Parameters:
        kList - the list of k (privacy factor or groups size) for each fragment
        Returns:
        a triplet containing the associations, the fragments and a set containing the index of dropped tuples
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if we encounter any exception, be sure to catch it somewhere.
